meta.name: Advanced Polycrisis Simulator Enhancements
meta.description: Next-generation enhancements including temporal dynamics, cross-domain impacts, stakeholder modeling, uncertainty quantification, and cultural variations

temporal_dynamics.description: Multi-timescale crisis evolution modeling for realistic scenario planning

timescales.name: Immediate Response
timescales.focus: Emergency response, first actions, immediate containment

timescales.name: Short-term Impact
timescales.focus: Resource allocation, public communication, supply chain disruption management

timescales.name: Medium-term Adaptation
timescales.focus: System adaptation, policy changes, economic recovery planning

timescales.name: Long-term Transformation
timescales.focus: Structural changes, learning integration, system redesign

cascade_mechanisms.name: Amplification Effects
cascade_mechanisms.description: How small initial disruptions can cascade into larger systemic failures

cascade_mechanisms.name: Delay Effects
cascade_mechanisms.description: Time lags between interventions and their observable effects

cascade_mechanisms.name: Memory Effects
cascade_mechanisms.description: How past events influence current system responses

cross_domain_impacts.description: Comprehensive modeling of interdependencies between economic, environmental, social, and technological domains

interaction_matrices.example: Economic growth drives increased resource extraction and environmental degradation
Environmental degradation leads to resource scarcity affecting social stability
Cyber attacks disrupt economic activities and financial systems
Social acceptance influences technology adoption and implementation

feedback_loops.name: Economic-Environmental Feedback
feedback_loops.description: Economic activities degrade environment, which increases costs and reduces economic capacity

feedback_loops.name: Social-Technology Feedback
feedback_loops.description: Technology displaces jobs, creating social pressure for regulation and retraining programs

stakeholder_interactions.description: Sophisticated modeling of stakeholder behavior, competition, cooperation, and strategic interactions

network_effects.name: Information Networks
network_effects.description: How information flows between stakeholders affect decision making
network_effects.impact_on_crisis: Critical for coordinated response and avoiding misinformation

network_effects.name: Resource Networks
network_effects.description: Dependencies and flows of resources between stakeholders
network_effects.impact_on_crisis: Determines vulnerability to supply disruptions and recovery capacity

network_effects.name: Influence Networks
network_effects.description: Power relationships and influence patterns between stakeholders
network_effects.impact_on_crisis: Shapes decision-making power and policy outcomes during crises

uncertainty_quantification.description: Systematic representation and communication of uncertainty in crisis projections and scenarios

uncertainty_types.name: Aleatory Uncertainty
uncertainty_types.description: Inherent randomness in natural and social systems
uncertainty_types.example: Weather patterns, market fluctuations, individual behavior variations

uncertainty_types.name: Epistemic Uncertainty
uncertainty_types.description: Uncertainty due to incomplete knowledge or understanding
uncertainty_types.example: Unknown climate tipping points, untested policy effectiveness, emerging technologies

uncertainty_types.name: Ambiguity
uncertainty_types.description: Uncertainty about the appropriate interpretation or model structure
uncertainty_types.example: Different economic theories, multiple crisis definitions, varying stakeholder interpretations

quantification_methods.name: Probabilistic Ranges
quantification_methods.description: Use probability distributions instead of point estimates

quantification_methods.name: Scenario Ensembles
quantification_methods.description: Multiple plausible scenarios with associated probabilities

quantification_methods.name: Sensitivity Analysis
quantification_methods.description: Systematic exploration of how uncertainties affect outcomes

communication_strategies.name: Confidence Levels
communication_strategies.format: High Confidence (>90%), Medium Confidence (60-90%), Low Confidence (<60%)

communication_strategies.name: Probability Ranges
communication_strategies.format: Very Likely (>90%), Likely (66-90%), As Likely As Not (33-66%), Unlikely (10-33%), Very Unlikely (<10%)
communication_strategies.use_case: Policy briefs and decision maker communications

communication_strategies.name: Visual Uncertainty
communication_strategies.format: Error bars, uncertainty bands, probability heat maps, scenario fans

cultural_regional_variations.description: Enhanced modeling of how different regions and cultures respond to crisis stimuli

cultural_dimensions.name: Power Distance
cultural_dimensions.description: Acceptance of hierarchical differences in power distribution

high_power_distance.crisis_response: Top-down decision making, centralized control, deference to authority
high_power_distance.communication_patterns: Formal channels, limited questioning of decisions

low_power_distance.crisis_response: Participatory decision making, distributed response, questioning authority

cultural_dimensions.name: Individualism vs Collectivism
cultural_dimensions.description: Emphasis on individual vs group interests and identity

individualistic.crisis_response: Self-reliance emphasis, individual preparedness, market-based solutions
individualistic.social_cohesion: Lower automatic compliance, higher need for incentives

collectivistic.crisis_response: Community-based response, collective responsibility, social solidarity
collectivistic.social_cohesion: Higher compliance with collective measures, group sacrifice acceptance

cultural_dimensions.name: Uncertainty Avoidance
cultural_dimensions.description: Tolerance for ambiguity and uncertain situations

high_avoidance.crisis_response: Detailed planning, rule-based approaches, risk-averse decisions
high_avoidance.adaptation_style: Structured, systematic, preference for proven solutions

low_avoidance.adaptation_style: Experimental, entrepreneurial, openness to novel approaches

impact_on_crisis_response.resource_availability: Higher development = more resources for crisis response
impact_on_crisis_response.institutional_capacity: Stronger institutions in more developed regions
impact_on_crisis_response.technology_access: Greater access to information and communication technologies

impact_on_crisis_response.vulnerability_patterns: Island nations face different challenges than continental regions
impact_on_crisis_response.response_strategies: Resource-rich regions may have different adaptation options

impact_on_crisis_response.institutional_memory: Previous crisis experience shapes response capabilities
impact_on_crisis_response.trust_levels: Historical experiences affect trust in institutions and authorities
impact_on_crisis_response.adaptive_capacity: Learning from past crises enhances future preparedness

early_warning_signals.description: Statistical pattern tracking that precedes critical transitions in complex systems

statistical_indicators.name: Increased Variance
statistical_indicators.description: Rising variability in key system indicators before critical transitions

statistical_indicators.name: Critical Slowing Down
statistical_indicators.description: Increased autocorrelation indicating system losing resilience

statistical_indicators.name: Flickering
statistical_indicators.description: Rapid switches between alternative system states

statistical_indicators.name: Spatial Correlation Changes
statistical_indicators.description: Changes in spatial correlation patterns across system components

resource_allocation_efficiency.description: Track effectiveness of resource deployment across crisis domains to identify bottlenecks

efficiency_metrics.name: Resource Utilization Rate
efficiency_metrics.description: Percentage of allocated resources actually deployed effectively

efficiency_metrics.name: Response Time Efficiency
efficiency_metrics.description: Time from resource allocation decision to effective deployment

efficiency_metrics.name: Cross-Domain Balance
efficiency_metrics.description: Distribution of resources across different crisis domains

efficiency_metrics.name: Adaptive Reallocation Speed
efficiency_metrics.description: Speed of resource reallocation in response to changing conditions

information_flow_quality.description: Track information spread, distortion, delays, and asymmetries affecting decision-making

quality_dimensions.name: Information Velocity
quality_dimensions.description: Speed of critical information propagation through stakeholder networks

quality_dimensions.name: Information Distortion
quality_dimensions.description: Degree of information accuracy degradation through transmission

quality_dimensions.name: Information Asymmetries
quality_dimensions.description: Differences in information access across stakeholder groups

quality_dimensions.name: Misinformation Spread
quality_dimensions.description: Rate and reach of false or misleading information

adaptation_capacity_metrics.description: Measure ability of systems to adapt to changing conditions through response time, innovation, and flexibility

capacity_indicators.name: Response Time Adaptability
capacity_indicators.description: How quickly systems can adjust response strategies to new conditions

capacity_indicators.name: Innovation Rate
capacity_indicators.description: Rate of development and deployment of novel solutions

capacity_indicators.name: Resource Flexibility
capacity_indicators.description: Ability to repurpose and reallocate resources across different needs

capacity_indicators.name: Learning Integration
capacity_indicators.description: Speed and effectiveness of integrating lessons learned into system operations

secondary_tertiary_effects.description: Systematic monitoring of second and third-order consequences of interventions and crisis developments

effect_categories.name: Unintended Consequences
effect_categories.description: Negative side effects of well-intentioned interventions

effect_categories.name: Behavioral Adaptations
effect_categories.description: How stakeholders change behavior in response to interventions

effect_categories.name: System Feedback Effects
effect_categories.description: How system responses create new conditions affecting future interventions

effect_categories.name: Interdomain Spillovers
effect_categories.description: How interventions in one domain affect other domains

tracking_methodology.impact_chain_mapping: Systematic mapping of potential consequence pathways
tracking_methodology.counterfactual_analysis: What would have happened without intervention
tracking_methodology.attribution_assessment: Distinguishing intervention effects from other factors

success_metrics.accuracy_improvement: Enhanced prediction accuracy through uncertainty quantification
success_metrics.stakeholder_engagement: Increased stakeholder buy-in through cultural sensitivity
success_metrics.decision_quality: Improved decision outcomes through better understanding of consequences
success_metrics.system_resilience: Enhanced system resilience through better adaptation modeling
